roleset.name: to persuade
roleset.note: COERCE-V NOTES: Based on WSJ; adjectival 'coercive' based on BOLT-6. Comparison with 'induce'. (from coerce.01-v)
COERCION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, coerce.01. Corresponds to VNcls force-59. (from coercion.01-n)
COERCIVE-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from coercive.01-j)

example.name: all arguments
example.text: Beijing lawmakers have called for jails to be built [*-3] [*-1]to house prostitutes and for severe punishment , including the death sentence , for anyone who [*T*-2] induces or coerces women into prostitution .

example.name: Adjectival rel: coercive
example.text: While applauding the provision , we should also be aware that the specific contents of the provision still do n't have a binding effect in a strict sense on the expected results , and some articles are still not coercive enough .

example.name: tricky arg0 and arg2
example.text: Neither the private coercion of capitalism , nor the state coercion of socialism is found in a communist society .

example.name: args 0 and 2 again
example.text: Neither the private coercion of capitalism , nor the state coercion of socialism is found in a communist society .

example.name: with arg1
example.text: Indigenous women's narratives also tell of their coercion into various forms of unpaid or low-paid labor...
example.arg: into various forms of unpaid or low-paid labor
